name: Ext.ux.gauge.Gauge
doc:
Displays a value within the given interval as a gauge. For example:

Ext.create({
    xtype: 'panel',
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 200,
    height: 200,
    layout: 'fit',
    items: {
        xtype: 'gauge',
        padding: 20,
        value: 55,
        minValue: 40,
        maxValue: 80
    }
});

It's also possible to use gauges to create loading indicators:

Ext.create({
    xtype: 'panel',
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 200,
    height: 200,
    layout: 'fit',
    items: {
        xtype: 'gauge',
        padding: 20,
        trackStart: 0,
        trackLength: 360,
        value: 20,
        valueStyle: {
            round: true
        },
        textTpl: 'Loading...',
        animation: {
            easing: 'linear',
            duration: 100000
        }
    }
}).items.first().setAngleOffset(360 * 100);

Gauges can contain needles as well.

Ext.create({
    xtype: 'panel',
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 200,
    height: 200,
    layout: 'fit',
    items: {
        xtype: 'gauge',
        padding: 20,
        value: 55,
        minValue: 40,
        maxValue: 80,
        needle: 'wedge'
    }
});

members.name: angleOffset
members.doc: The angle at which the minValue starts in case of a circular gauge.
members.short_doc: The angle at which the minValue starts in case of a circular gauge. ...

members.name: animation
members.doc: The animation applied to the gauge on changes to the value and the angleOffset configs. Defaults to 1 second animation with the 'out' easing.

properties.name: duration
properties.doc: The duraction of the animation.

properties.name: easing
properties.doc: The easing function to use for the animation. Possible values are: - linear - no easing, no acceleration - in - accelerating from zero velocity - out - (default) decelerating to zero velocity - inOut - acceleration until halfway, then deceleration

members.short_doc:
The animation applied to the gauge on changes to the value
and the angleOffset configs. ...

members.name: clockwise
members.doc: true - cfg!value increments in a clockwise fashion false - cfg!value increments in an anticlockwise fashion
members.short_doc:
true - cfg!value increments in a clockwise fashion
false - cfg!value increments in an anticlockwise fashion ...

members.name: maxValue
members.doc: The maximum value that the gauge can represent.
members.short_doc: The maximum value that the gauge can represent. ...

members.name: minValue
members.doc: The minimum value that the gauge can represent.
members.short_doc: The minimum value that the gauge can represent. ...

members.name: needle
members.doc:
A config object for the needle to be used by the gauge. The needle will track the current value. The default needle type is 'diamond', so if a config like

needle: {
    outerRadius: '100%'
}

is used, the app/view still has to require the Ext.ux.gauge.needle.Diamond class. If a type is specified explicitly

needle: {
    type: 'arrow'
}

it's straightforward which class should be required.
members.short_doc: A config object for the needle to be used by the gauge. ...

members.name: padding
members.doc: Gauge sector padding in pixels or percent of width/height, whichever is smaller.
members.short_doc: Gauge sector padding in pixels or percent of width/height, whichever is smaller. ...

members.name: textAlign
members.doc: If the gauge has a donut hole, the text will be centered inside it. Otherwise, the text will be centered in the middle of the gauge's bounding box. This config allows to alter the position of the text in the latter case. See the docs for the align option to the Ext.util.Region.alignTo method for possible ways of alignment of the text to the guage's bounding box.
members.short_doc: If the gauge has a donut hole, the text will be centered inside it. ...

members.name: textOffset
members.doc: This config can be used to displace the text from its default position in the center of the gauge by providing values for horizontal and vertical displacement.

properties.name: dx
properties.doc: Horizontal displacement.

properties.name: dy
properties.doc: Vertical displacement.

members.short_doc:
This config can be used to displace the text from its default
position in the center of the gauge by providing values...

members.name: textTpl
members.doc: The template for the text in the center of the gauge. The available data values are: - value - The cfg!value of the gauge. - percent - The value as a percentage between 0 and 100. - minValue - The value of the cfg!minValue config. - maxValue - The value of the cfg!maxValue config. - delta - The delta between the cfg!minValue and cfg!maxValue.
members.short_doc: The template for the text in the center of the gauge. ...

members.name: trackLength
members.doc: The angle in the (0, 360] interval to add to the trackStart angle to determine the angle at which the track ends.
members.short_doc:
The angle in the (0, 360] interval to add to the trackStart angle
to determine the angle at which the track ends. ...

members.name: trackStart
members.doc: The angle in the [0, 360) interval at which the gauge's track sector starts. E.g. 0 for 3 o-clock, 90 for 6 o-clock, 180 for 9 o-clock, 270 for noon.
members.short_doc: The angle in the [0, 360) interval at which the gauge's track sector starts. ...

properties.name: fill
properties.doc:
Track sector fill color. Defaults to CSS value. It's also possible to have a linear gradient fill that starts at the top-left corner of the gauge and ends at its bottom-right corner, by providing an array of color stop objects. For example:

trackStyle: {
    fill: [{
        offset: 0,
        color: 'green',
        opacity: 0.8
    }, {
        offset: 1,
        color: 'gold'
    }]
}

properties.name: fillOpacity
properties.doc: Track sector fill opacity. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: stroke
properties.doc: Track sector stroke color. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: strokeOpacity
properties.doc: Track sector stroke opacity. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.doc: Track sector stroke width. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: outerRadius
properties.doc:
The outer radius of the track sector. For example:

outerRadius: '90%',      // 90% of the maximum radius
outerRadius: 100,        // radius of 100 pixels
outerRadius: '70% + 5',  // 70% of the maximum radius plus 5 pixels
outerRadius: '80% - 10', // 80% of the maximum radius minus 10 pixels

properties.name: innerRadius
properties.doc: The inner radius of the track sector. See the trackStyle.outerRadius config documentation for more information.

properties.name: round
properties.doc: Whether to round the track sector edges or not.

members.name: value
members.short_doc: The current value of the gauge. ...

properties.name: fill
properties.doc: Value sector fill color. Defaults to CSS value. See the trackStyle.fill config documentation for more information.

properties.name: fillOpacity
properties.doc: Value sector fill opacity. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: stroke
properties.doc: Value sector stroke color. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: strokeOpacity
properties.doc: Value sector stroke opacity. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.doc: Value sector stroke width. Defaults to CSS value.

properties.name: outerRadius
properties.doc: The outer radius of the value sector. See the trackStyle.outerRadius config documentation for more information.

properties.name: innerRadius
properties.doc: The inner radius of the value sector. See the trackStyle.outerRadius config documentation for more information.

properties.name: round
properties.doc: Whether to round the value sector edges or not.

members.name: fxValue
members.short_doc: either the value or the angleOffset animation ...

members.name: pathAttributes
members.default: {fill: true, fillOpacity: true, stroke: true, strokeOpacity: true, strokeWidth: true}

params.name: fn
params.doc: Function to execute on every frame of animation. The function takes a single parameter - the value in the [from, to] range, interpolated based on current time and easing function. With certain easings, the value may overshoot the range slighly.

members.name: createInterpolator
members.doc: Creates a linear interpolator function that itself has a few methods: - setDomain(from, to) - setRange(from, to) - getDomain - returns the domain as a [from, to] array - getRange - returns the range as a [from, to] array

params.name: rangeCheck
params.doc: Whether to allow out of bounds values for domain and range.

return.name: return
return.doc: The interpolator function: interpolator(domainValue, isInvert). If the isInvert parameter is true, the start of domain will correspond to the end of range. This is useful, for example, when you want to render increasing domain values counter-clockwise instead of clockwise.

members.short_doc:
Creates a linear interpolator function that itself has a few methods:
- setDomain(from, to)
- setRange(from, to)
- ge...

members.name: fitSectorInRect
members.doc: Given a rect with a known width and height, find the maximum radius of the donut sector that can fit into it, as well as the center point of such a sector. The end and start angles of the sector are also known, as well as the relationship between the inner and outer radii.
members.short_doc:
Given a rect with a known width and height, find the maximum radius of the donut
sector that can fit into it, as well...
